title: Opossum input schema
description: Input files consist of a file tree, signals with attribution information for parts of the tree, and metadata.

resources.description: A file tree stored recursively. Folders are objects with their child filenames as fields, files are the number `1`.

metadata.description: The entire metadata can be viewed by the user in the `File` menu, and can contain more entries than specified here.

projectId.description: An ID for the compliance scan, to be copied into the output file.

projectTitle.description: To be shown as application title when the file is opened.

externalAttributions.description: Signals containing attribution information about a file or folder. Each signal gets a UUID as attribution ID.

name.description: Where the information came from (e.g. a tool like ScanCode)

documentConfidence.description: How much the information is trusted (0: bad, 100: good)

additionalName.description: Original source for suggested signals (e.g. a tool like ScanCode)

packageName.description: Name of the package (part of a package URL)

packageVersion.description: Version of the package (part of a package URL)

packageNamespace.description: Namespace of the pacakge, e.g. Github user (part of a package URL)

packageType.description: Protocol of the package, e.g. npm, maven (part of a package URL)

packagePURLAppendix.description: Qualifiers and subpaths of a package URL

url.description: URL for the source website of the package

licenseName.description: Name of the license, ideally SPDX identifier but can also contain arbitrary names

attributionConfidence.description: How much the information is trusted (0: bad, 100: good)

comment.description: Additional human-readable comments about the attribution that don't fit into other fields

criticality.description: Indication on how critical a signal is. Possible values are "high" and "medium".

firstParty.description: Indicates that something is first-party code.

preSelected.description: Pre-selected attributions are directly converted from signals into selected attributions when the input file is opened.

excludeFromNotice.description: Indicates that an attribution should not be included in a notice file.

followUp.description: Indicates that an attribution is problematic and needs to be followed up.

originId.description: Deprecated - originIds should be used instead. Can be set to track a signal from the tooling that generated the input file. Will be copied into the output when the signal is converted into an attribution.

originIds.description: Like originId but considers that a signal can have more than a single origin.

preferred.description: Indicates that the attribution has been marked as preferred by a user.

preferredOverOriginIds.description: OriginIds of all attributions this one is preferred over.

wasPreferred.description: Indicates that the attribution had previously been marked as preferred.

resourcesToAttributions.description: Map from a path in the resource tree (e.g. `/folder/subfolder/`, `/folder/file`, note the mandatory slashes at the beginning and end) to a list of attribution IDs.

frequentLicenses.description: A list of frequent licenses that can be selected in a dropdown when the user enters a license name.

fullName.description: Human-readable name of the license, currently unused

shortName.description: Typically the SPDX identifier, to be shown in the dropdown

attributionBreakpoints.description: A folder paths where attribution inference stops, e.g. node_modules.

filesWithChildren.description: A list of folders that are treated as files. This can be used to attach another file tree to files like `package.json`, usually also setting an attribution breakpoint.

baseUrlsForSources.description: Map from paths to the respective base url. The base url should contain a {path} placeholder. E.g. https://github.com/opossum-tool/opossumUI/blob/main/{path}. The base url might be null to indicate a missing link.

externalAttributionSources.description: A mapping of attribution sources to prettified names and priority, which is used for ordering in the PackagePanel. The lower the number the further up the source appears in the PackagePanel.
